thread.title: Three villages in Kherson region receive humanitarian aid from U.S. benefactors
thread.title_full: Three villages in Kherson region receive humanitarian aid from U.S. benefactors

author: @ukrinform
title: Three villages in Kherson region receive humanitarian aid from U.S. benefactors
text:
Three villages in Kherson region receive humanitarian aid from U.S. benefactors photos 24.06.2024 01:38 Ukrinform In the Kherson region, residents of three villages - Myroliubivka, Parysheve and Myrne - received humanitarian aid from American philanthropists - family food packages. The Kherson Regional Military Administration said this in a post on Telegram , Ukrinform reports.
<script async src="https://telegram.org/js/telegram-widget.js?22" data-telegram-post="khersonskaODA/20893" data-width="100%"></script>
"Another humanitarian cargo from American benefactors was delivered to the Kherson region. Volunteers of the Global Empowerment Mission Foundation in cooperation with the Howard G. Buffett Foundation distributed family food packages to residents of the villages of Myroliubivka, Parysheve and Myrne," the statement said.
As noted, the food packages include long-term storage products: flour, pasta, sugar, cereals, stewed meat, canned food, condensed milk, cookies, and more.
The RMA thanked the benefactors for their continued assistance to the Kherson region’s residents.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, the Mykolaiv region received significant humanitarian aid thanks to donors and partners such as the Crimean Front, UAIM Humanitarian Fund, and KSRelief.
